*House-made Cranberry syrup: 
-- 2 cups Fresh Cranberries

Ingredients: 1500 ml BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, 750 ml Lemon Juice, 750 ml Pineapple Gomme Syrup*, .5 oz Fee Bros Lemon Bitters, 1 float Old Vine Zin
Preparation:
*Pineapple Gomme: 
Mix equal parts (1.5 cups) gum arabic with water over high heat until it all mixes and then let cool for a bit. Then you're gonna make a sugar syrup with 2 parts sugar, 1 part water (4 cups water, 2 cups white granulated sugar) in the same manner over high heat until it mixes, and then add the gum syrup to the mix until everything dissolves and what you're left with is a thick gummy syrup that resembles a whole lot of baby batter. Then cut up 1.5 cups of pineapple chunks, put in mason jar, and pour the gum syrup over it and let it sit in the refrigerator over night. A few hours would work also if you don't have that much time. However, the more time, the more pineapple infusion takes place. When it's ready, strain into another mason jar or bottle, and it's ready to go.

*House-made Simple Syrup: 
-- 1 cup Sugar
-- 1 cup Water

Add equal parts sugar and water into a small saucepan, bring to a boil; simmer until the sugar is dissolved, approximately 3 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature and transfer to a clean glass jar. Cover and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Jasmine Tea/Rice-Infused Junipero Gin*, .75 oz Leopold Bros. Sour Apple Liqueur, .75 oz Lime, .5 oz House-made Honey Syrup**, .25 oz Lo-Fi Gentian Amaro
Preparation:
Add all ingredients in a cocktail shaker, shake, fine strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass. Garnish with edible flower.

*Jasmine Tea/Rice-Infused Junipero Gin:
-- 1 bottle (750ml) Junípero gin
-- .5 cup Jasmine Tea
-- .5 cup Jasmine Rice (wash rice to eliminate starch)

Sous Vide Version: Wash the jasmine rice to clean out the starch. Fill container with hot water. Set sous vide at 52c. Add vacuum seal bag with jasmine tea/rice in bath. Let sit in bath for 45 minutes. Take the bag out of bath and sit it in ice bath for 15 minutes. Open bag and fine strain back into bottle.

Infusion Version: Wash the jasmine rice to clean out the starch. In a cambro/mason jar, add Junípero gin and jasmine tea and rice. Let infuse for 24 hours. Fine strain into bottle.

**House-made Honey Syrup: 

Put equal parts of honey (10 oz) and water (10 oz) in a saucepan. Boil, then turn down to a simmer and stir until the honey is completely dissolved.

Soak 1 ghost pepper in a 16 oz. bottle of Campari for up to 24 hrs (reduce infusion time to reduce heat).

Soak 3 cinnamon sticks in 16 oz. of any neutral grain alcohol that is high proof (regular 80-proof vodka is great) for up to 14 days. Strain and discard the sticks.

1.5 cups strawberries
0.5 cups sugar
2 tsp black peppercorns
0.25 cups balsamic vinegar
0.25 cups champagne vinegar

Combine all ingredients except vinegar in a container and let sit overnight at room temperature.
The sugar should be absorbed by the strawberry juice.
The next day, puree with a blender and add any additional vinegar to taste.
Strain the shrub through chinois to remove any large leftover chunks.
Label and date and keep in the fridge.

*Clarified Milk:
-- 1 C Whole Milk
-- .5 oz Lemon Juice

Heat milk to just before a simmer, then add lemon juice. Lightly stir to break the solid from the whey. Let chill for 5 mins to allow the solids to properly separate. Coffee strain twice for clarity.

Preparation: Build in an ice filled 14 oz beer glass, add BarSol Pisco, Ginger Liqueur, fresh lime juice, and agave nectar. Roll into a Boston shaker and shake to mix, place cranberry bitters on top, add ginger beer and garnish with a wedge of fresh lime.
Notes: Featured on The Tales of the Cocktail 2016 Carousel Bar Menu

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .25 oz Small Hand Foods Pineapple Gum Syrup, 1 bsp Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Build in an old fashioned glass over ice. Garnish with orange peel.
Notes: Featured on Speed Rack 2015 SF Speed City Takeover Baseball Card.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter, .5 oz Cold Blue Bottle Coffee, .25 oz Luxardo Anisette, 2 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: Build in collins glass. Top with soda. Orange peel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vino Chinato, 1.5 oz Fig-Infused C. Drouin Calvados Selection, .5 oz Lemon, .25 oz Simple Syrup
Preparation: Build in glass. Add crushed ice and swizzle. Top with more crushed ice. Dash pepita tincture on top for aromatics. Garnish with lemon wheel and dried fig.

Ingredients: 35 ml King's Ginger Liqueur, 125 ml Fever-Tree Bitter Lemon
Preparation: Build in ice-filled tall glass, garnish with a squeeze of lime.

Ingredients: 2 oz English Harbour Rum 5 YO, 2 oz Fresh Squeezed Pineapple Juice, 2 oz Fresh Coconut Water

Ingredients: 2 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, 3 oz Prosecco, 1 splash Sparkling Water

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whiskey, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter, .75 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, 2 dash Chocolate Bitters

Ingredients: .75 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .75 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .75 oz Green Chartreuse, .5 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Pineapple Juice
Preparation: Cold shake-strain into coupe and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.

Preparation: Combine all ingredients and stir. Pour the mixture into a chilled Nick & Nora glass and garnish with the orange zest.

Preparation: Combine all ingredients besides beer and bitters and dry shake without ice. Add ice and re-shake, double strain into a fizz glass and top with beer. Garnish with shaved nutmeg and 3 drops of bitters.

Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Maurin Quina, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur
Preparation: Combine all ingredients besides blood orange into a mixing glass and stir until proper dilution (15-20 seconds). Pour into a small martini glass. Rub a thin slice of blood orange around the rim and place in drink.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Genevieve Gin, .25 oz Rich Wild Sage Honey Syrup, 1 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 dash Whiskey Barrel Aged Bitters, .75 oz Spring Water

All ingredients should be kept at room temperature.

Preparation:

Preparation: Combine all ingredients except soda in a shaker with ice, shake to combine. Pour into a coupe glass and garnish with a lemon peel.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Round Pond Meyer Lemon Syrup, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 splash Soda water
Preparation: Combine all ingredients except soda in a shaker with ice, shake to combine. Pour over ice in a rocks glass and top with soda. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.

Preparation:
Combine all ingredients except soda in a tin and dry shake. Add ice and shake vigorously. Add soda into a collins glass and slowly strain the drink over it until it forms a head. Garnish with one rhubarb stalk.

750 ml of gin with 3 chopped stalks of fresh rhubarb for 48 hours

Ingredients: 1.5 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Elderflower Liqueur, 2 dash Absinthe,  top Sparkling Wine
Preparation: Combine all ingredients except sparkling wine in a shaker. Add ice and shake until chilled through. Double strain into a champagne flute and garnish with an orange twist.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Forester Bourbon, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Giffard Crème de Pêche de Vigne, .5 oz Honey syrup (local honey cut 2:1 with water), .75 oz Lemon juice, 1  Egg white, 1 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Combine all ingredients except the bitters and dry shake. Add ice and shake again. Strain over fresh ice into a double old fashioned glass. Dash bitters over the top of the cocktail. Garnish with a dried peach and a piece of candied ginger.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, 6 oz Tomato Juice, 1.5 tsp Demitri's Bloody Mary Seasoning, .5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice
Garnish: Cocktail Shrimp, Lemon Zest, Celery Stalk
Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a chilled mixing glass, rimmed with sea salt and stir. Add ice. Stir again to mix. Garnish with a cocktail shrimp, lemon zest, fresh ground pepper and a celery stalk.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Fresh-pressed Lemon Juice, .5 oz Snake Oil's House-made Sarsaparilla Syrup, .75 oz Carbonated Water, 1 dash Snake Oil's House-made Pomegranate Bitters
Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a Collins glass and stir. Garnish with a slice of ginger and lemon wheel.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 1 oz Apricot brandy, .5 oz Dry vermouth, .5 oz Sweet vermouth
Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a frozen mixing glass with hard ice and stir for 20 seconds. Strain into a frozen coupe glass.
Notes:
Vermouth: Vermouth, like wine goes bad if it has been open for a while. Also it's best to keep it in the refrigerator after it has been open to keep it fresh. Vermouth will last about 3-4 months. There are many producers of vermouth, all varying in style and flavor, so we would recommend trying a couple out and finding which you prefer. It's also fun to taste the difference. This goes for both dry (French) and sweet (Italian). Depending on the type you use, you might want to adjust the quantities used in your cocktail to your liking.

Apricot brandy: There are many brands out there. We like to use the Rothman & Winter. Unlike other fruit liqueurs that can be cloyingly sweet, the Rothman & Winter delivers a sweetness and bouquet expected when enjoying a fresh apricot.

This is a nice cocktail for vodka martini drinkers that want a little twist on their cocktail. It's essentially a perfect martini made with vodka and apricot brandy.

Preparation: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, add ice and stir. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Apricot Eau-de-Vie, .25 oz Grenadine, 2 dash Lemon Bitters, 2 dash Absinthe

Ingredients: 1 oz Glenrothes Bourbon Reserve, 1.5 oz C. Drouin Pommeau de Normandie, .5 oz Chamomile Tea Syrup*, .75 oz Lemon Juice
Preparation:

-- 2 c water
-- 1 c chamomile flower
-- 1 c sugar

Add 1 cup chamomile flower and 1 more cup of water, bring back to a boil.

*0.25 - 0.50 oz Cane Sugar Syrup (to taste to allow variations in citrus flavor when batching)

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1.5 oz Averna, .75 oz Honey, 1 whole Egg
Preparation: Combine all ingredients, shake for 20 seconds. Add ice and shake again. Strain into a snifter. Garnish with shaved nutmeg.

Ingredients: .75 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .75 oz El Tesoro Reposado Tequila, .5 oz Grüner Veltliner, .5 oz Lime, .25 oz Pineapple Gum, 1 bsp Sweet Marmalade
Preparation: Combine all ingredients. Shake and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Gran Duque d Alba Solera gran Reserva brandy, .75 oz Carpano Antica Vermouth, .25 oz Benedictine, 1 tincture Peychaud's Bitters, 1 tincture Angostura bitters
Preparation:
Combine all liquid ingredients in a chilled mixing glass with cracked ice and stir for 20 seconds.

Notes:
This cocktail is a spin on a classic cocktail called the "Vieux Carré" or "Old Square". The original cocktail was created by a bartender at The Hotel Monteleone in New Orleans. Though this drink may have been derived from a traditional vermouth cocktail created in the mid-1800s, many people who encounter the Vieux Carré today will equate it to a Manhattan variation, served on the rocks.

This new or "Nieux" version is a little nuttier and lighter in body. The nutty flavors of the sherry brandy really play off the savory earthy notes of the Karlsson's Gold Vodka. Enjoy this cocktail with some cheese or as an after dinner drink. It is perfect in front of a fireplace.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Esprit de June, .5 oz Fresh lemon juice, .5 oz Simple syrup
Preparation:
Combine all liquid ingredients in a highball or Collins glass with ice.
Stir lightly and garnish with a lemon twist making sure to release all the essential oils out of the twist. Also make sure to rub the entire rim of the glass with the twist before dropping it into the cocktail.
Notes:
This is a perfect spring or summer cocktail. The Esprit de June is a product that offers a touch of floral complexity. The brightness of the lemon really works well with the floral notes of the Esprit de June.

The name is a play on words stating that less is more or (L.E.S. is more). The L.E.S. is an abbreviation for two things. First being Lower East Side as it is a NYC inspired cocktail. Second being Lemon, Esprit de June, and Seltzer. The three ingredients used in the cocktail to complement the Karlsson's Vodka.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 1 oz Citadelle Gin, 2 dash Orange Bitters, .25 oz Rose Poached Pear Syrup*, 1 oz Topo Chico Mineral Water, 1 oz Fever-Tree Sparkling Lemon
Preparation:
Combine all liquids with exception of sodas, sir together. Strain into collins glass with singular large cube. Top with sodas. Garnish with sliver of poached pear from syrup (kept chilled).

*Rose Poached Pear Syrup:
-- 1.5 C Rose (La Vielle Ferme or similar)
-- 1.5 C Water 
-- 2 C Sugar
-- 1 Large Lemon
-- 1 Half Orange
-- 1 tsp Ground Ginger (not fresh)
-- 1 tsp Vanilla
-- 3-5 Whole Cloves

Combine Rose (La Vielle Ferme or similar), water, and sugar. Bring to a simmer. Add zest of lemon and an orange, ground ginger, vanilla, and cloves. Peel and halve pears, set gently into liquid. Keep just under a simmer for 15 mins. Remove from heat, let cool at least 20 mins. Pears will keep for 3 days refrigerated in syrup. The syrup itself will last longer.

Ingredients: 9 oz C. Drouin Calvados Selection, 6 oz Marrakesh Mint Tea, 6 oz Prosecco, 3 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 2 oz Lemon Juice, 1.5 oz Velvet Falernum, .5 oz Dale DeGroff's Pimento Aromatic Bitters
Garnish: Orange wheels studded with cloves, Mint sprigs
Preparation: Combine all the ingredients except Prosecco. Add a large block of ice or large ice cubes and stir. Top with Prosecco. Garnish with orange wheels studded with cloves and float some mint sprigs in the bowl.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz J.H. Cutter Whisky, 1 oz  Moroccan Mint Tea (chilled)*, .75 oz The King's Ginger, .5 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Rich Honey Syrup**
Preparation:
Combine all the ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for about 10 seconds. Strain in to an Old Fashioned glass or glass of your choosing. Add large ice cubes. Garnish with a lemon wheel, mint sprigs and a blackberry.

*Moroccan Mint Tea (Numi Tea Brand):
-- 1 Moroccan Mint Tea Bag
-- 8 oz. Boiling Water
 
Combine the tea bag and the boiling water in a cup or a pot. Let steep for 5 minutes. Remove the tea bag and place the tea in the fridge to cool. Label and date the container. Will keep for 1 week.

**Rich Honey Syrup:
-- 10 oz. Honey
-- 5 oz. Hot Water

Combine both ingredients together in a container and stir until fully incorporated. Label and date the container. Will keep in the fridge for 2 weeks.
Notes: This can be served individually, but can also be made in to a punch and just served over one large block of ice. Just garnish with lots of lemon wheels, mint leaves and blackberries.

Ingredients: 2 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, 1 bsp Kalani Coconut Liqueur, 1 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: Combine all the ingredients in an old-fashioned glass. Stir on the rocks. Garnish with lemon peel.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .5 oz Orange-scented Maple Syrup*, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso
Preparation:
Combine bourbon, lemon juice, and syrup in a shaker and add cold ice. Shake until chilled well (10-30 sec. depending on the quality of the ice). Strain into a collins glass and slowly pour the vermouth into the glass. Garnish with a lemon twist. 

*Orange-scented Maple Syrup:
combine 6 oz. of grade B maple syrup, 6 oz. filtered water and the peel of 1 orange, with a minimum amount of pith in a non-reactive pan. 
Simmer for 10 mins. Remove from heat and allow it to cool to room temp. before using. 
Syrup will keep for 1 month if refrigerated.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 1 oz Grapefruit Juice, .75 oz Lemon Juice, 1 dash Tempus Fugit Abbott's Bitters,  to fill Anchor California Lager
Preparation: Combine Gin, Maraschino, juices, and bitters in an ice-filled mixing tin and shake for 20-30 seconds, or until well chilled. Strain over fresh ice into a Collins glass, top with the California Lager, and garnish with the grapefruit peel.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE (Brown Butter-Infused), 0.5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 3 dash Fee Brothers Black Walnut Bitters
Preparation: Combine H by HINE, King's Ginger Liqueur, and bitters over ice in a mixing glass. Stir until you reach proper dilution(15-20 seconds). Strain over a large ice rock in a bucket glass and garnish with Luxardo Cherries.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .75 oz Lime Juice,  top Ginger Beer
Preparation: Combine Hophead Vodka, Kings Ginger, and lime juice in a Collins glass and fill with ice. Top with ginger beer. Stir. Garnish with a lime wheel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Hophead Vodka, .75 oz Giffard Pamplemousse, .5 oz Lemon Juice, 2 dash Orange Bitters,  top IPA
Preparation: Combine Hophead, lemon juice, Giffard Pamplemousse, honey syrup, and bitters in a shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled glass. Fill the glass with beer.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 3 oz Breckle's Brown Ale, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .5 oz Honey Syrup, .5 oz Egg White, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Combine Hophead, lemon juice, King's Ginger, honey syrup, egg white, and bitters in a shaker and dry shake to emulsify egg whites. Add ice and shake vigorously until proper dilution. Strain into a chilled fizz glass. Empty ice out of shakers and fill shaker with ale to create a froth. Pour this froth over the drink and garnish with half an orange wheel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz HINE Rare VSOP, .5 oz Cynar, .5 oz Bywater Spice Mix*, 1 oz Cold-Brew Coffee
Preparation:
Combine ingredients and shake with ice. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Grate nutmeg on top.

*Bywater Spice Mix: Simple syrup infused with Vietnamese cinnamon, licorice root, and clove

Ingredients: 2 oz Christmas Spirit, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth Bianco, .25 oz Luxardo Triplum (Triple Sec), 1 dash Fee Brother's Orange Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and stir with ice. Strain and serve up with an orange twist.

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, 1 dash Tempus Fugit Abbott's Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a flamed orange peel.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 1 oz Barr Hill Gin, .75 oz Falernum, 1 oz Topo Chico Mineral Water, 1 dash Lemon Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients in a pint glass, stir with ice to chill. Double strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with mint and lemon wedge flag.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Oloroso Sherry, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Winter Spice Brown Sugar Syrup*, 1 oz Pineapple Juice
Preparation:
Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and double strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with nutmeg.

*Winter Spice Brown Sugar Syrup: 
-- 2 qt Brown Sugar
-- 2 qt Water
-- 3 Tbsp Ground Ginger
-- 3 Tbsp Ground Nutmeg
-- 1 Tbsp Clove

Heat and simmer the below ingredients in a medium pot for 15 minutes. Strain with cheesecloth.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 2 oz Old Tom Gin, .75 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, .25 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 2 dash Orange Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and stir for 20 to 30 seconds, or until well chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon peel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Tom Gin, 1 oz Barolo Chinato, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Kina L'Aero d'Or
Preparation: Combine ingredients in an old fashioned glass filled with ice, stir to combine, and garnish with orange peel.
Notes: Photo credit: Brian Oh

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 1 oz Reisetbauer Carrot Eau De Vie, .75 oz Genevieve Gin
Preparation: Combine ingredients in mixing glass, and stir with ice to dilution. Strain into a coupe cocktail glass. Garnish with a trimmed carrot ribbon.

Ingredients: 1 part No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 part Rooibus Tea (steeped and cooled), 1 part Mulled Cider (cooled), .5 part Clover Honey Syrup, .33 part Cava,   Angostura
Preparation: Combine ingredients into a chilled punch bowl, ice and dilute appropriately, garnish seasonally.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Nikka Whisky Miyagikyo Single Malt 12 YO, .75 oz Rare Wine Co. Charleston Sercial Madeira, .75 oz Fresh lime juice, .625 oz Small Hands Food orgeat
Preparation:
Combine ingredients into a cocktail shaker. 
Shake with ice vigorously for 10-15 seconds. 
Strain into a chilled coupe glass. No garnish.
Notes: http://www.foodrepublic.com/2014/11/07/miyagikyo-kick-cocktail-recipe

Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Clover Honey Syrup
Preparation: Combine ingredients into a hot mug, top with hot water and garnish with a rough orange twist.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .5 oz Pimms, 1 bsp Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 1 oz Fresh lime juice, .75 oz Simple syrup, 5 leaves Basil leaves
Preparation: Combine ingredients into a mixing glass, add ice and shake until properly diluted. Double strain into a glass over fresh ice, garnish with a cucumber wheel.

Ingredients: 1 oz BenRiach Single Malt 12 YO, 1 oz C. Drouin Calvados Selection, 1 oz Luxardo Aperitivo
Preparation: Combine ingredients with ice in a mixing glass and stir. Strain over a large cube in a rocks glass and garnish with an orange peel.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Tom Gin, 1 oz Cocchi Vermouth di Torino, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, 3 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients, stir until well chilled, and strain in to a cocktail glass. Serve with an orange twist.

Ingredients: 2 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Carpano Antica, 1 bsp Calisaya, 3 dash The Bitter Truth Grapefruit Bitters
Preparation: Combine ingredients. Pour over big cube and stir. Add the grapefruit peel.

Ingredients: .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz Dolin Blanc, 2.5 oz Prosecco
Preparation: Combine Luxardo Bitters and Dolin Blanc. Stir in mixing glass until chilled. Strain into flute. Top with prosecco. Zest with grapefruit. Garnish with long grapefruit zest.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .25 oz Castilian Tincture*, .75 oz BarSol Supremo Moste Verde Italia Pisco, 2 oz Prosecco
Preparation:
Combine Luxardo, BarSol, and tincture. Ice, stir, and strain into chilled coupe. Top with Prosecco. Gently set candied blood orange wheel (thinly sliced) garnish into drink and serve.

*Castillian Tincture:
-- 750 ml Luxardo Grappa Euganea
-- 20 g Sliced Blanched Almond
-- 2 g Spanish Saffron
-- 3 Sliced Madagascan Vanilla Beans
-- 3 g Toasted Green Cardamom
-- 4 Lemon Peels (pith removed)
-- 2 Quartered Dried Pajarero Figs
-- 2 Quartered Quartered Medjool Dates

Combine all ingredients, gently agitate twice daily for 14 days. Fine filter and store.

**Candied Blood Orange Wheels:
-- 1 Blood Orange (sliced thin - approx. 10 slices/orange)
-- .5 c Natural Sugar
-- .25 c Water
-- 2 Tbsp Corn Syrup

Combine sugar, water, and corn syrup in shallow saucepan. Slow simmer on low heat approx. 10 min. When thickened mixture begins to cling to sides of pan, add orange slices. Allow to simmer for 5 more min. and remove from hardening syrup. Place slices on parchment-lined oven rack. Air dry overnight, then bake 10 min. at 400°F (or dehydrate them).

Ingredients: .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz Avua Cachaca Prata, .75 oz Broker's London Dry Gin, .75 oz Coconut Water, 2 dash Toasted Coconut Tincture*, 1 dash Almond Extract,  top Fever-Tree Mediterranean Tonic Water
Preparation:
Combine Luxardo, cachaca, gin, coconut water, tincture and almond extract in a yari (mixing glass). Add ice. Stir for proper dilution (30-40 revolutions). Pour in collins glass over a clarified ice sphere. Top cocktail with Fever-Tree. Add 3 almond slices for garnish.

*Toasted Coconut Tincture:
-- 4 oz (by weight) Semisweet Coconut Flakes
-- High-Proof Neutral Grain Spirit (preferably Everclear)

Lightly toast semisweet coconut flakes. Put in a small mason jar. Fill jar with high-proof neutral grain spirit. Let sit for 3 days then strain off.

Ingredients: .5 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1.5 oz Apple Water*, 1 ml Citric Acid Solution**
Preparation:
Combine Luxardo, gin, apple water and citric acid solution into a shaker tin and shake to chill. Double strain into a coupe glass and garnish with a slice of Fuji apple lightly dusted with cinnamon.

*Apple Water:
-- 1 Fuji Apple
-- 2 c Water

Slice Fuji apple and combine with water. Vacuum seal and place in a sous-vide for 3-4 hrs at 130°F. Strain apples; water is ready for use.

**Citric Acid Solution:
-- 1 ml gram Citric Acid
-- 3 ml Water

Combine citric acid and water. Stir until dissolved.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz D'aristi 10 YR Rum, .5 oz The Genuine Curacao Liqueur Blue, .25 oz Tempus Fugit Liqueur de Violettes, 1 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Tahitian Vanilla Bean Syrup, 1 float Ginger Beer, 3 dash Angostura Bitters
Garnish: Grilled Pineapple Wedge, Luxardo Cherries, Edible Orchid
Preparation: Combine rum, curacao, violettes, and lime juice in a shaker, add ice and shake vigorously. Double strain into a chilled collins glass. Add fresh ice in the collins glass and top with chilled ginger beer. Float 2-3 dashes of Angostura Bitters on top and garnish with a grilled pineapple wedge on rim of glass, and two Luxardo Cherries speared through a toothpick, and edible orchid placed on top hanging from the rim.
Notes: *Ice: Bar Ice & Vintage Ice

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, .25 oz Absinthe, 4 oz Hot coffee, 2-3 oz Homemade Irish Cream
Preparation: Combine the coffee and whiskey in a preheated cup. Top with Irish cream and pour the absinthe over the back of a spoon to float. Garnish.
Notes: *this drink was served at Portland Cocktail Week 2013

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Light Rum, .75 oz  Cointreau, .75 oz Lime Juice, .25 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .125 oz Simple Syrup (optional)
Preparation: Combine the ingredients in a Boston shaker or cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Strain the contents into a chilled cocktail glass.
Notes: Photo credit: Roger Kamholz

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Tom Gin, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth Bianco, .5 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, .5 oz Lemon Juice
Preparation:
Combine the ingredients. Shake and strain over ice. Lemon and/or cherry flag garnish.

Add soda water if you'd like to water it down.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 2 oz Fresh grapefruit juice, 1 oz Club soda, 1 tincture Grapefruit bitters
Preparation: Combine the Karlsson's Gold Vodka and grapefruit in a shaker with ice. Shake for 15 seconds and strain over fresh ice in an old-fashioned glass that has a salted rim. Top the cocktail with the club soda.
Notes: Play around with different kinds of salt. The salty swede uses yuzu salt.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Giffard Elderflower Liqueur, 1 oz Lime Juice, 8-9 drops Chili Tincture*, 6  Luxardo Maraschino Cherries
Preparation:
Combine the lime, elderflower, tincture and cherries into a shaker tin. Muddle the cherries and then add the Junipero Gin. Shake with ice. Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

*Chili Tincture:
-- Chiles (Habaneros or Bird’s eye Chiles recommended)
-- Grain Alcohol or Vodka

Fill a small jar with stemmed hot chili peppers and cover with grain alcohol or high-proof vodka. Let soak for 3 days; strain.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 3 oz Coca-Cola, .5 oz Lime Juice
Preparation: Combine the Pink Pigeon, the cola, and the lime juice, in a tall Collins glass full of ice cubes.

Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 3 oz Ginger Beer, .5 oz Lime Juice
Preparation: Combine the Pink Pigeon, the ginger beer, and the lime juice, in a tall Collins glass full of ice cubes.

Ingredients: 3 oz Domingo Perez Marin 'la Guita' Manzanilla Sherry, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .25 oz Chartreuse , .25 oz Juice of an Orange
Preparation: Combine these ingredients and roll gently over ice and strain into a martini glass. Top with pumpkin foam.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Absolut Vodka, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice , 1 oz Ginger-Cinnamon Syrup*, 2 dash Bar Keep Lavender Spice Bitters,  top Club Soda
Preparation:
Combine vodka, ginger liqueur, lemon juice, ginger-cinnamon syrup and bitters in tins with ice and shake. Double strain into collins glass over fresh ice and top with club soda.

*Ginger-Cinnamon Syrup: 
Equal parts demerara sugar, clover honey, fresh ginger juice, water. Combine demerara sugar and clover honey and top with boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Once cooled add fresh ginger juice and stir to mix.

Ingredients: 4 pieces Lime, 1-2 Tbsp Sugar, 1 1/2 oz Ypiòca
Preparation: Cut a lime in 4 pieces and put them in a glass. Add 1-2 tablespoons of sugar and crush with a pestle. Add Ypiòca. Fill with crushed ice. Stir well and enjoy!

Ingredients: 1 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 fill Champagne, 1 dash Angostura bitters, 1 dash Peach bitters, 1 dash Luxardo Fernet
Preparation: Dash each bitter and the Fernet over sugar cube in base of Champagne glass so that the sugar is fully saturated with mixture. Add Pink Pigeon Rum and top with chilled Champagne. Garnish with a twist of lemon.

Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Briottet Creme de Framboise (Raspberry), .5 oz Lemon juice, .25 oz Simple syrup*
Preparation: Double strain into a martini glass.
Notes: *Simple syrup is infused with basil leaves and cherry tomato confit muddled.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz C. Drouin Calvados Selection, .75 oz Orgeat, .5 oz Lemon Juice, 1 oz Pear & Celery Puree, .5  Egg white
Preparation: Dry Shake (no ice), Wet Shake (with ice) & Double Strain.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 1 oz Rye Whiskey, 1 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Angostura Bitters, 1  Egg White
Preparation: Dry shake all ingredients for 20-30 seconds. Then shake with ice. Double strain over fresh ice in an old fashioned glass. Garnish with wide lemon swath.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Bourbon, .5 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, .5 oz Demerara Syrup (1:1), .75 oz Lemon Juice, 1  Egg White
Preparation: Dry shake all ingredients. Hard shake with ice. Double strain into small pilsner glass. Garnish with Luxardo Cherry.

Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .25 oz English Harbour Rum, 3 spoon Sugar, 1 whole Egg, .5 oz Milk, .5 oz Cream
Preparation: Dry shake and then shake with hand cracked ice. Serve in a goblet with grated nutmeg.

Ingredients: 1 oz Glenrothes Vintage Reserve, 1 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .25 oz Green Chartreuse, .75 oz Sweetened Apple Cider, 2 dash Baked Apple Bitters, 1 whole Egg
Preparation: Dry shake whole egg until emulsified. Then add Kold Draft ice and all ingredients except bitters and shake vigorously until cold. Strain into chilled royal coupette and garnish with apple wheels.

Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .75 oz Lime juice, .75 oz Hibiscus/rose syrup, 1  Egg white
Preparation: Dry shake, add ice and shake again. Strain into a coupe glass.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .5 oz Jummai Ginjo Sake, .25 oz Luxardo Limoncello, .25 oz Dill Cordial, .5 oz Meyer Lemon Juice, .25 oz Yuzu Juice, .5 oz Fresh egg White
Preparation: Dry Shake, add ice and shake for 10 seconds. Double strain into a Copita Glass. Garnish with Dill.

Ingredients: 30 ml Pink Pigeon Rum, 15 ml Dry Oloroso Sherry, 15 oz Grenadine, 1 whole Egg,   Vanilla-Salt Spray
Preparation: Dry shake, shake with cubed ice, double strain into chilled glass coated in vanilla-salt solution.

Ingredients: 40 ml Pink Pigeon Rum, 10 ml Campari, 10 ml Lavender syrup, 10 ml Lemon juice , 10 ml Orange juice, 25 ml Egg white
Preparation: Dry shake, shake with cubed ice, double strain into chilled glass.

Ingredients: .5 oz H by HINE, .5 oz El Dorado 12 Year Old Rum, .5 oz Hamilton Black Jamaican Pot Still Rum, .5 oz Cinnamon Syrup, .5 oz Heavy Cream, 1 tsp St. Elizabeth Allspice Dram, 1 whole Egg,  top Founders Porter
Preparation: Dry shake, strain, top with porter.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 2.5 oz Fresh orange juice, 1 Tbsp Luxardo Bitter, 1 dash Milk powder (or cream)
Preparation: Dry shake, then serve old-fashioned glass with crushed ice. Drizzle Bitter on top to finish.

Ingredients: 1 oz BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, 1.25 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Peach Brandy, .5 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Egg white
Preparation:
Dry shake, then shake with ice. Double strain into flute or sour glass. Top with a Saison.

Zest orange over top and garnish with a star anise.

Ingredients: 50 ml King's Ginger Liqueur, 4  Pink Peppercorns, 25 ml Fresh lemon juice, 15 ml Gomme syrup, 25 ml Egg white
Preparation: Dry shake, then shake with ice. Double strain over cubed ice.

Ingredients: 2 oz C. Drouin Calvados Selection, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .75 oz Giffard Abricot du Roussillon, .5 oz Egg White
Preparation: Dry shake. Add ice, shake. Double strain into a frozen coupe glass. Garnish with lemon twist or dehydrated apple slice.

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, .5 oz Green Chartreuse, .5 oz Lime juice, 1 oz Pineapple juice, .5 oz Jalapeño Syrup, .5 oz Egg White
Preparation:
dryshake/shake/dblrocks

garnish jalapeño slice

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 8 oz Apple Cider,  oz Heavy Cream,  oz Cinnamon
Preparation: Fill a 10-oz mug with boiling water. When the mug is hot, pour out the water and add the amaretto and cider. Top with a layer of cream. Grate fresh cinnamon on top as a garnish.

Ingredients: 2 oz Mezcal, 2 oz Reed's Premium Ginger Brew, 1 tsp Seedless Blackberry Jam, 1  Lime, juiced, 12  Mint Leaves, muddled
Preparation: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add all ingredients except the garnish and shake well. Stain into a very chilled martini glass (martini glass should have a sugar rim on half of the glass) and top with a splash of ginger beer. Garnish with a mint leaf and orange peel. Right before serving drop in a chip of dry ice for the mist.
Notes: Cocktail created by interior designer contest winner, Tineke Triggs.

Ingredients: 1 oz Mezcal, .75 oz Aperol, .5 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .75 oz Lime Juice
Preparation: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add ingredients and shake well. Strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass and garnish with the grapefruit twist.
Notes: Photo credit: Tina Rupp

Ingredients: 1 oz Blended Lightly Aged Rum, 1 oz Blended Aged Rum, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, .5 oz SC Demerara Syrup*, .5 oz Grapefruit Juice, 2 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation:
Fill a collins or highball glass with cracked or cubed ice. Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker filled with cracked or cubed ice. Shake and strain into the glass.

*SC Demerara Syrup:
-- 2 C Water
-- 1 C Demerara Sugar
-- 3 C Granulated Sugar

Bring water to boil in a saucepan over high heat. Add the demerara sugar and stir vigorously with a whisk (or use an immersion blender) until sugar is dissolved, about 1 minute (the water should become clear). Add granulated sugar and stir vigorously until dissolved, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and let cool.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Cherry Syrup (from jar of cherries), .25 oz Fresh Lemon Juice (optional), 6 oz Soda Water
Preparation: Fill a highball glass with ice, and build the syrup, lemon juice, and soda water. Stir, and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.

Ingredients: 2 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Luxardo Orgeat Syrup, 3 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Fill a mixing glass half full with ice. Add cognac, orgeat, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist lemon peel over the drink and drop in as a garnish.
Notes: Photo credit: seriouseats.com

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, .5 oz Benedictine, .5 oz Orange juice, .5 oz Honey
Garnish: Long orange peel studded with cloves
Preparation: Fill a mug with very hot water to warm the glass up. Once the glass is hot, empty it and add all the liquid ingredients. Stir well until the honey is incorporated. Garnish with the clove studded orange peel and enjoy.
Notes: This is a nice simple winter warmer that will hit the spot after a nice dinner. Vinterpäls is the Swedish word for winter jacket. When we first made this, we wanted to be up in the mountains at a ski resort in a hot tub...

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Prichard's Lincoln County Lightning, .5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 oz Cinnamon-Candied Ginger Syrup*, 3 dash Angostura Bitters,  top Club Soda
Garnish: Lemon Wheel, Sliver of Cinnamon-Candied Ginger
Preparation:
Fill a shaker with an old fashioned glass worth of ice. Add all ingredients except for the club soda. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds, then dump into old fashioned glass. Set lemon wheel and sliver of cinnamon-candied ginger on top then top with club soda.

*Cinnamon Candied Ginger Syrup:
Combine 1/4 lb. peeled ginger root (sliced 1/8" on a 45-degree bias using a mandolin), 2 cups of water, and 4 cinnamon sticks in a pot (or pan) and bring to cusp of a light simmer. Continue to barely simmer for 30 minutes. Add 1 cup of demerara sugar and stir until fully dissolved. Lower heat and keep just below simmering. Continue to heat until almost all liquid is reduced and remaining sugar is just beginning to caramelize (2-3 hours). Remove from heat and spoon slivers of ginger (along with a generous dollop of now thick syrup) onto a sheet of parchment or wax paper. Let cool for at least 2 hours then store layered on the paper sealed in a ziplock bag. Remove cinnamon sticks and reserve syrup.

Ingredients: .5 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, .5 oz D'Aristi Xtabentun Honey Liqueur
Preparation:
Fill Chinaco stemmed flute with prosecco, cava or other dry sparkling.
Garnish with Luxardo Cherry pinned inside of lemon peel and rested across rim.
The cherry garnish which will be EVER so delicately laid across the top of the glass, should flame in my opinion. You can dip the in high-proof spirits and light it up!

Ingredients: 1 oz Japanese Whisky, 3 oz Amaro Angeleno, 1 oz Luxardo Orgeat Syrup, 1 oz Lemon Juice
Preparation: Fill shaker with ingredients and ice. Shake. Strain into old fashioned or rocks glass filled with ice.
Notes: Photo credit: liquor.com

Ingredients: 1.5 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, .5 oz Luxardo Limoncello, .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, 3 oz Tonic water
Preparation: Fill up a stem-less wine glass with ice and pour the ingredients over, stir and serve.
Notes: Adapted from Francesco Lafranconi's recipe in the Luxardo cocktail book. He originally called for Luxardo Dry Gin, which we have replaced with No.3 London Dry Gin.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, .75 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, .5 oz Fresh Lime Juice, 1 float Bitter Lemon Soda
Preparation: Fill up a stemmed wine glass with ice then pour the ingredients, stir and serve.

Ingredients: .75 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, .75 oz BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, .75 oz Elderflower Liqueur, 2 oz White dry white(preferably Sauvignon), 2 oz Club soda
Preparation: Fill up a wine glass with ice then pour the ingredients, stir and serve.

Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, 1 oz Fresh lime juice, 1 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Egg white, 3 dash Angostura bitters
Preparation: First, dry shake all ingredients. Then, shake all ingredients vigorous with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with 2-3 drops of Angostura bitters on top of the foam.

Ingredients: 2 oz Mezcal, 1 oz Jamaica basil flower syrup*, .75 oz Fresh grapefruit juice, .5 oz Fresh lime juice
Preparation: Flash shake, strain onto fresh ice, top with Mexican Squirt. Salted starfruit garnish.
Notes: *1:1 sugar (raw) to water, macerating a handful of basil flowers and two handfuls of dried jamaica flowers to each 2L of water.

Ingredients: 2 part Ypioca Brasilizar Cachaca Prata Classica, 1 part Fresh Lime Juice, .5 part Agave, .5 part Ancho Reyes Ancho Chile Liqueur
Garnish: Pineapple Chunks, Dried Ancho Chiles, Star Anise
Preparation: For a punch, combine Ypioca, lime, agave and Ancho Reyes together. Add fresh pineapple chunks, 3 thin sliced chiles (seeds included) and 1 star anise to garnish.
Notes:
"Inspiration - let's just say I took creative license with a classic caipirinha recipe."
- Lauren Sanchez

Ingredients: 2 part Ypioca Brasilizar Cachaca Prata Reserva Especial, .5 part Lillet Rose, .5 part Guava Nectar, .25 part Fresh Lime Juice, .25 part Agave,  top Banfi Rosa Regale Sparkling Wine
Preparation:
For punch, combine Ypioca, Lillet Rose, guava nectar, lime and agave. Top with Rosa Regale sparkling and add sliced strawberries and thin-sliced lime wheels to float as garnish.

For individual cocktails, muddle 2-3 strawberry slices w/ agave and add Ypioca, guava and Lillet. Add ice and shake to chill/mix. Strain over ice and top with champagne. Garnish with thin-sliced strawberry. Remember, this is an aperitif style so it's meant to be refreshing but not necessarily sweet.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz BarSol Supremo Moste Verde Italia Pisco, 1.25 oz Fresh Cantaloupe Juice, .5 oz Fresh Lime Juice, .75 oz Beet Sugar Water*, 1  Egg White
Preparation:
Garnish with 3 drops of Angostura Bitters over foam.

*Beet Sugar Water:
-- 50% Beet Sugar
-- 50% Water
Notes: Featured on Extra TV June 2016

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .75 oz Darjeeling simple syrup, 1 oz Lime juice
Preparation: Garnish: mint and lime wheel

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Old Tom Gin, .5 oz 7-Spice Syrup*, .75 oz Lemon Juice, 1.5 oz Fever-Tree Tonic
Preparation:
Garnished with orange peel and star anise. Served over the rocks in a stemless wine glass.

*7-Spice Syrup:
-- Pink Peppercorn
-- Star Anise
-- Sumac
-- Cinnamon
-- Nutmeg
-- Coriander
-- Cardamom

Ingredients: 1 oz Genevieve Gin, 1 bottle Lager
Preparation: Genevieve is Hotaling's interpretation of genever, an ancient and mysterious gin style. The most common way to consume genever has always been straight. If you are planning to set sail for the day, picnic or do something else to enjoy the great outdoors, we recommend throwing a bottle of Genevieve in the freezer the evening before your outing and moving it to the cooler day of. We sip it straight while enjoying a lager. Glassware is dealer's choice, but cordial glasses are elegant and fun.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, 2.5 oz Old Tom Gin, 2 bsp Real Lemon Juice, 2 bsp Strawberry-Raspberry Simple Syrup*
Preparation:
Hard vigorous shake with high density ice for 5-6 seconds. Hawthorne and fine strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a mint sprig spanked and lightly rubbed around the edge of the glass. Raspberry garnish and mint sprig attached to the raspberry. Channel zest lemon bath over the glass.

*Strawberry-Raspberry Turbinado "Sugar in the Raw" Simple Syrup:
-- 2 C Water
-- 2 C Sugar in the Raw Turbinado Sugar
-- 15 Raspberries
-- 3 Strawberries, quartered
-- 3 Mint Leaves

As the water boils, slowly add sugar a few spoon fulls at a time and whisk vigorously into the boiling water until all 2 cups have been dissolved. Continue to keep on high heat for 5 mins.
Then take raspberries, strawberries, and mint leaves and macerate all components together and add into the boiling simple syrup.
Reduce heat to low-medium heat for the next 15 mins.
After that allow simple syrup to cool down and rest for additional 15 mins. 
Double strain the simple syrup through fine strainers until all fruit, seeds and mint leaves are strained out.  Allow to cool.

Ingredients: 1.25 oz Glenrothes Vintage Reserve, .75 oz Drambuie, 2 oz Woodchuck Pumpkin Cider, .75 oz Spiced Butter*, 3 dash Bittermens Elemakule Tiki Bitters
Preparation:
Heat cider to 180°F. In a 5 oz cup pour the scotch and drambuie. Add the heated cider. Stir in the spiced butter. Top with 3 drops bitters.

For the garnish, add 2 small cocktail stirrers, hang cookie off of the stirrer so that it leans off of the side of the cup.

*Spiced Butter:
-- 1 half Stick Butter
-- 1 tbsp Pumpkin Pie Spice
-- .5 tbsp Brown Sugar
-- .5 tsp Cayenne Pepper

Soften butter, add spices and mix with a spoon until all ingredients are combined.

**Chrusciki Cookies:
-- 1 c All-purpose Flour
-- 3 Egg Yolks
-- 3 tbsp Sour Cream
-- 1 tsp Vanilla Extract
-- 1 tbsp Dark Rum
-- 1 pinch Salt

Using a mixer, incorporate egg yolks into sour cream, add vanilla and rum, kneed in all-purpose flower and salt to taste.
Divide dough in half on a floured board and let rest for 20 min. Working with half the dough at a time, roll out to 1/8 in. thickness, cut into 2 in. wide strips, cut these strips on the diagonal at 4 in. intervals.
Heat 2 in. of vegetable oil in a large deep skillet to 350°F. Make a slit in the center of each strip of dough. Pull one end through the slit to form a bow.
Fry 6 Chrusciki at a time for 1 min. or less per side till golden brown.
Drain on a paper towel and dust with confectioners sugar.

Ingredients: 1 pkg, 14 oz Cranberries, 1.5 c Brown Sugar, .5 c Orange Juice, .3 c King's Ginger Liqueur, 8 whole Pepper Corns, 6  Allspice Berries, 5  Cloves, 1 stick, 2 in Cinnamon
Preparation: Heat cranberries, sugar, OJ and King's Ginger over medium heat. Place the peppercorns, allspice, cloves and cinnamon in a piece of cheesecloth with the end tied. Add to pot. Cook stirring often until cranberries soften about 25 to 30 min. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Reposado Tequila, .75 oz D'Aristi Xtabentun Honey Liqueur, 3 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: Ice: Large block or spherical

Ingredients: 2 oz White Rum, 1.75 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, 1 oz Coconut Milk, 1 oz Fresh Lime Juice, .5 tsp Demerara Sugar, 10 dash Miracle Mile Forbidden Barrel Aged Bitters, 3  Roasted Cherries, 1 oz Black Rum, 1 tsp Everclear
Preparation: In a blender, combine white rum, Luxardo, coconut milk, lime juice, sugar, bitters, 3 cherries, and 1 cup ice and purée until smooth; pour into a tiki glass and top with black rum. Place halved cherry, cut-side up, on top of cocktail and fill with Everclear before lighting cherry on fire.
Notes: http://www.saveur.com/roasted-cherries-recipe

Ingredients: 1 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka (Coffee-Infused), .75 oz Café Moka, .75 oz Cardamom syrup*, 2 Tbsp Soy milk coffee foam**, 1 pinch Espresso powder
Preparation: In a Boston shaker combine all liquid ingredients (not the foam) with cracked ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Double strain the cocktail into an espresso cup. Using an aero-latte frothing whip froth the coffee infused soy milk and spoon the froth over the cocktail. Sprinkle with a little espresso powder.
Notes:
Coffee-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka (yield- 750 ml.):

Ingredients & Equipment
- 1 750 ml. Bottle Karlsson's Gold vodka
- .75 c. Coffee beans
- French press
- Coffee grinder

Instructions
Grind the coffee beans and add them to the French press. Pour in the vodka and press. Let steep at room temperature for 12-24 hours. Strain out the coffee grounds and store in a sealed container in the refrigerator.

---

*Cardamom Syrup (yield- 1 pt.):

Ingredients
- .5 c. Whole green cardamom pods
- 1 lb. Granulated sugar
- 2 c. Water

Instructions
In a 1 qt. saucepot bring the water and sugar to a boil. Once boiling add the cardamom pods and remove from the heat. Let steep 30 minutes and strain the cardamom pods out using a fine mesh sieve. Store in a covered container in the refrigerator. It should keep for a while in the fridge.

---

**Coffee Soy Milk (yield- 1 c.):

Ingredients
- 8 oz. Soy mik
- 1 oz. Simple syrup
- 2 Tbsp. Espresso powder

Instructions
Blend the two ingredients until the espresso powder is completely dissolved.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka (Root-Infused), .5 oz Cardamaro, .5 oz Fresh lemon juice, .5 oz Grade-A dark maple syrup, 1.5 oz Fenteman's ginger beer, 4 inch Whole licorice root
Preparation: In a Boston shaker combine all liquid ingredients except the ginger beer with whole hard ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds. Double strain the cocktail over whole hard ice cubes in a 13 oz. rocks glass and top with the ginger beer. Garnish with the licorice root.
Notes:
Root-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka:

Ingredients & Equipment
- 5 750 ml. Bottles Karlsson's Gold Vodka
- 5 oz. Sarsaparilla (Can be purchased at Kalustyan's)
- 5 oz. Sassafras (Can be purchased at Kalustyan's)
- 2.5 oz. White birch bark (Can be purchased at Kalustyan's)
- 2.5 oz. Licorice root (Can be purchased at Kalustyan's)
- 5 l. Barrel from Tuthilltown distillery
- Spice grinder
- Cheesecloth
- 10 qt. Non-reactive sealable container
- Fine mesh sieve

Instructions
Soak the barrel in water for 24 hours to swell the wood staves and to seal the barrel. (If you put liquid into a dry barrel it will leak.)
Rinse the sarsaparilla, sassafras, white birch bark and licorice root in cold water and lay out on parchment paper to dry. Once dry roughly grind the ingredients using a spice grinder and add them to a 10 qt. sealable non-reactive container. Pour the vodka into the container (reserve the bottles), cover and let infuse for 6 hours shaking every hour. Once fully infused strain out the roots and barks out using a fine mesh sieve and cheesecloth.
Using a funnel fill the barrel with the infusion and plug the barrel. Let infuse for 1-2 months tasting until desired oak flavor is achieved. Note: The barrel can be used several times but the aging time will take longer the more you use it. For example the second time you might need to age it for 2-3 months. Once desired oak age is achieved remove the infusion from the barrel and pour it back into the bottles There will be less then what you started with due to evaporation and soaking. Use as a base for cocktails. It makes an interesting old-fashioned.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Lustau Amontillado Sherry, .75 oz St. Elizabeth Allspice Dram, .75 oz Burned Demerara Sugar Syrup*, 1 tincture Bob's Vanilla Bitters, .75 oz Vanilla Powder, 1  Egg White
Preparation: In a Boston shaker combine all liquid ingredients in a shaker without ice and dry shake for 10-12 shakes to blend the egg whites. Once blended add cracked ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds and strain into a frozen 4.5 oz. coupe glass. Let the cocktail settle and sprinkle with the vanilla powder.
Notes:
*Burned Demerara Sugar Syrup (yield- 1 pt.):

Ingredients & Equipment
- .5 lb. Demerara sugar (sugar in the raw)
- 2 c. Water
- Blow torch
- Immersion blender

Instructions
In a wide bottom saucepot add the sugar and brulè it until just burned. Add the water to the pot and simmer until it is dissolved. Use an immersion blender to break up the chunks of burned sugar. Strain the syrup through a fine mesh sieve and store covered in the refrigerator. It should keep for a while.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 oz Rothman & Winter Orchard Pear Liqueur, .75 oz Cranberry Juice, 1 tincture Fee Brothers Cranberry Bitters, 10  Fresh Cranberries
Preparation: In a Boston shaker combine and muddle the fresh lemon juice and cranberries. Add the remaining liquid ingredients except the club soda with hard ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds pour directly into a highball add a little more ice to fill the glass and top with the club soda. Garnish with a few pear slices and fresh cranberries.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Boiron Kalamansi Juice, .5 oz Thai Basil Syrup*, .5 oz Cocchi Americano, 2 oz Fentimans Ginger Beer
Preparation:
In a Boston shaker, combine all liquid ingredients except the ginger beer with cracked ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds. Double strain over ice into a 16 oz. highball or Collins glass and top with the ginger beer. Garnish with the candied ginger using 2 toothpicks placed on the rim of the glass.

*Thai Basil Syrup:
-- 1 C Chopped Thai Basil
-- 2 C Granulated Sugar
-- 1 C Water

In a 1 qt. saucepot bring the water and sugar to boil and stir until sugar is completely dissolved. Add the chopped Thai basil to the pot and remove from heat. Let the basil steep for 1 hour or until syrup is room temperature. Strain the basil out of the syrup using a fine mesh sieve and store covered in fridge.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Oatmeal-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka*, 1.5 oz Ginger Beer, .5 oz Oloroso Sherry, .25 oz St. Elizabeth Allspice Dram, .25 oz Molasses, 1 bsp Pumpkin Puree, 1 tincture Fee Brothers Black Walnut Bitters
Preparation:
In a Boston shaker, combine all liquid ingredients except the ginger beer. Shake vigorously for 25 seconds and strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass. Top with the ginger beer and grate the fresh nutmeg over the top.

*Oatmeal-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka:
-- 750 ml Karlsson's Gold Vodka
-- 2 C Raw Oats

Using a large sauté pan toast the oats for about 10 minutes constantly watching them and making sure they don't burn. Once aromatic and have a touch of color add the oats to a mason jar with the vodka and let infuse for 12-24 hours. Strain and press out all the vodka from the oats. Return the liquid to the bottle and store in a cool dark place.
Notes: This cocktail is nice to serve with a little bowl of toasted and salted pumpkin seeds.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Pineapple juice, .5 oz Fresh lime juice, .5 oz Kaffir lime & tamarind compound syrup*
Preparation: In a Boston shaker, combine all liquid ingredients with cracked ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds. Double strain into a frozen 4.5 oz. coupe glass. Garnish with 1/2 piece kaffir lime leaf. (Clap the leaf several times before placing on top of the cocktail to release the aromatics.)

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Apple & Cinnamon-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz J. T. Taylor's Falernum, .5 oz Fresh lemon juice, 1 oz Fresh Cider, 1 tincture Bar Keep Baked apple bitters
Preparation: In a Boston shaker, combine all liquid ingredients with cracked ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds. Double strain into a frozen 4.5 oz. coupe glass. Garnish with the apple slice. Can also be served warm.
Notes:
Apple & Cinnamon-Infused Karlsson's Gold Vodka (yield- 750 ml.):

Ingredients
- 3-4 Crisp apples such as pink lady or honey crisp (cored and sliced)
- 6 Whole cinnamon sticks

Instructions
In a large canning jar, combine all ingredients. Reserve the bottle for storage later. Shake well and store in cool dry place for 24 hours. Once infused strain through a fine mesh strainer and discard apples and cinnamon. Using a funnel pour the infusion back into the bottle and store it in a cool dark place.

Ingredients: 1 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 1 oz Lemon curd (or a large bar spoon), 1.5 oz Brut Champagne
Preparation: In a Boston shaker, combine the Karlsson's and the lemon curd with whole hard ice and shake vigorously for 30-40 seconds. Add the champagne to the shaker, stir until mixed well and double strain the cocktail into a 4.5 oz. coupe glass. Garnish the cocktail with a lemon twist making sure to release all the essential oils into the glass. Rub the entire rim with the twist before dropping the twist into the glass.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Hophead Vodka, .75 oz Luxardo Espresso Italian Liqueur, 2 oz Cream, 2 oz Mexican Coca Cola
Preparation: In a bucket glass, combine Hophead, coffee liqueur, and cream. Add Ice and give a quick stir. Top with cold Mexican Coke and garnish with a Luxardo Cherry.

Ingredients: 1 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 2.5 oz Spiced apple shrub*, 2 oz Chilled club soda
Preparation: In a chilled mixing glass combine the Karlsson's gold vodka and the spiced apple shrub with cracked ice and stir for 20 seconds. Add the chilled club soda to the mixing glass, stir just until mixed and strain into a frozen champagne flute. Garnish with two apple slices placed on the rim.
Notes:
*Spiced apple shrub (yield- 1 qt.):

Ingredients
- 6 Organic apples (any kind, but I prefer to use gala and honey-crisp)
- 1 c. Dark brown sugar
- 1 c. Demerara sugar (sugar in the raw)
- 10 Allspice berries
- 3 Cinnamon sticks
- 2 tsp. Ground nutmeg
- 2 tsp. Ground mace
- 2 oz. Fresh ginger
- 4 Cloves
- 2 c. Apple cider vinegar (I like to use good stuff that has been aged in barrel)

Instructions
Core and chop the apples into one inch pieces and muddle them with the sugar and the spices. This should be done in small batches. Muddle them until the apples start to release their juice.
Let this mixture sit for 24 hours. This lets the apples have time to release more of their juice into the sugar and spice mixture.
The next day add the vinegar and mix well. Pour the mix into a large mason jar and let brew for a week at room temp in a dark place.
Once the week is over stir the mixture well and strain through a fine mesh sieve. Warm the shrub up if you still have residual sugar in the mix.
Cover and store in the refrigerator. This product has a very long shelf life.

Ingredients: 1 oz Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey, .5 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, .33 oz Luxardo Fernet, .75 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Homemade orgeat, 4 dash Angostura bitters, 3 dash Fee Bros Orange bitters
Preparation: In a collins glass, add ingredients beginning with orgeat and ending with rye. Fill glass half full with minted crushed ice. Begin "swizzling" cocktail with stick until cocktail is blended and ice forms on outside of glass. Top with more minted crushed ice and garnish with lemon and mint.

Ingredients: 25 ml No.3 London Dry Gin, 25 ml King's Ginger Liqueur, 12.5 ml Red Vermouth (Antica Formula), 150 ml Good quality sharp lemonade
Preparation: In a highball glass full of ice add No.3, King's Ginger and red vermouth. Top up with the lemonade and serve with a slice of ginger and a wedge of pink grapefruit.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Aperol, .5 oz Raspberry/white pepper syrup, .5 oz Fresh lemon juice, .5 oz Fresh cucumber juice, 4-5 pc Fresh mint, 2 dashes Celery bitters
Preparation: In a mixing glass muddle mint, add all other ingredients and ice, shake, fine strain into a double old fashioned glass over fresh cracked ice. Garnish with cucumber slices and raspberries.

Ingredients: .75 oz Rye Whiskey, .75 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth Bianco, 1 bsp Benedictine, 2 dash Angostura Bitters, 2 dash Peychaud's Bitters
Preparation: In a mixing glass, add all ingredients, then fill halfway with ice. Stir with a barspoon until chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Rub the lemon twist around the rim, drop it in the cocktail, and serve.
Notes: Photo credit: chowhound.com

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Mezcal, .5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 oz Apple Cider Reduction, .5 oz Cinnamon-Chipotle Syrup*, 1 dash House-made Apple Pie Bitters**
Preparation:
In a mixing glass, add ice and shake with all of the ingredients. Strain over new ice (large sphere ice cube) and serve in old fashioned glass and grate fresh cinnamon over the ice.

*Apple Cider Reduction: Boil apple cider until it reduces in volume by half.

**Cinnamon-Chipotle Syrup: Bring 1 cup sugar, 1 cup water and 3 cinnamon sticks to boil, take off heat and let steep for 20mins, add chipotle powder and mix well.

Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 2 dash Fee Brothers Black Walnut Bitters, .5 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, .5 oz Luxardo Fernet
Preparation: In a mixing glass, add the first three ingredients over ice. Stir to chill. In a separate coupe glass, add .5 oz of Luxardo Fernet and swirl glass until it is fully coated with the Fernet. Strain chilled cocktail from mixing glass into the Fernet-rinsed coupe (discard excess fernet). Garnish by placing a Luxardo Cherry into the bottom of the glass.

Ingredients: 50 ml Pink Pigeon Rum, 50 ml Lychee juice, .5  Lime, juiced, 1  Passion fruit, 1 float Ginger beer
Preparation: In a mixing glass, combine Pink Pigeon Rum, Lychee Juice and the juice from 1/2 a lime. Add the pulp of one passion fruit (to prep passion fruit: cut in half, setting aside a small slice for garnish and scoop out the pulp and drop both the pulp and peel into the glass). Add ice and shake vigorously. Pour in a tall glass over ice, top with ginger beer.  Garnish with the passion fruit wedge to serve.

Ingredients: 1.75 oz Chinaco Anejo Tequila, .5 oz Xtabentun Liqueur (honey, anis), 3 dash Bittermens Xocolatl Mole Bitters, 3 dash Fee Brothers Aztec Chocolate Bitters
Preparation: In a pint glass pour all the ingredients, stir and strain into a bucket glass 3/4 full of ice and garnish with an orange peel.

Ingredients: 1 part No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 part King's Ginger Liqueur, .5 part Red Vermouth (Antica Formula), 6 part Good quality sharp lemonade
Preparation: In a punch bowl add ingredients per person.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz Spiced Apricot Syrup*, .5 oz House-made Orgeat, .5 oz Lemon Juice,   Egg Whites,  top Anchor Christmas Ale 2016
Preparation:
In a shaker mix all ingredients discarding the beer and dry shake vigorously to activate the egg whites. Add ice and shake for about 10 sec and double strain into 8 oz glass and top with beer. Garnish with a marigold flower.

*Spiced Apricot Syrup:
-- Organic Earl Grey Tea
-- Green Cardamom
-- Juniper Berries

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz St. Germain, .25 oz Yellow Chartreuse, .75 oz Lemon Juice, 1  Strawberry
Preparation: In a shaker, gently muddle the strawberry. Add the remaining ingredients and shake with ice. Strain into a coupe. Garnish with strawberry.

Ingredients: 2 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Fresh lemon juice, 1 oz Simple syrup, 5 leaves Mint leaves
Preparation: In a shaker, muddle the mint and simple syrup. Add the lemon juice and gin, and fill with ice. Shake, and double-strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.

Ingredients: 1 oz Vanilla flavored Vodka, .75 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh sweet n' sour mix, 3 oz Prosecco,  oz Sliced plum, 2 sprigs Mint sprig
Preparation: In a tall glass muddle the mint and plum with fresh sweet n' sour, pour the liquors then fill up with ice and top with Prosecco.
Notes: When out of season, substitute plum with canned apricot.

Ingredients: 2.5 oz Nikka Coffey Malt Whisky, .5 oz Demerara Syrup, 4 dash Tempus Fugit Abbott's Bitters
Preparation: In an old fashioned glass, muddle the lemon peel with the bitters and demerara syrup, just enough to bruise the peel and release its oils. Add Coffey Malt and ice, and stir for 20 to 30 seconds, or until well chilled.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz English Harbour Rum 5 YO, .25 oz Honey, 3  Lime Wedges, 4  Basil Leaves,  top Ginger Ale
Preparation: In collins glass, gently muddle honey, lime and basil leaves. Add English Harbour rum and ice and stir. Top with ginger ale.

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, .5 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, .5 oz Dolin Vermouth, 2 dash Tempus Fugit Abbott's Bitters
Preparation: In mixing glass or cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine whiskey, vermouth, and bitters. Stir well, about 20 seconds, then strain into cocktail glass. Add cherry and serve.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Junipero Gin, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Lime Juice, .25 oz Pomegranate Syrup, 4 large Mint Leaves
Preparation: In mixing glass, using a spoon, crush 2 mint leaves in the simple syrup, and add gin, lime juice and pomegranate syrup. Pour into ice-filled shaker. Shake well and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Float remaining 2 mint leaves for garnish.
Notes: Photo credit: Lizzie Munro

Ingredients: 2 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, .5 oz Creme de Cacao, .25 oz Pierre Ferrand Dry Orange Curacao, 3 dash The Bitter Truth Jerry Thomas Bitters
Preparation: In old fashioned glass, lightly muddle orange zest with bitters and orange curacao.  Add bourbon and creme de cacao then stir with ice for proper dilution (depending on ice) and mixing of ingredients.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Luxardo Espresso Italian Liqueur, 1.5 oz Heavy cream, .75 oz Simple syrup
Preparation:
In one shaker, mix heavy cream and simple syrup and dry shake vigorously until it's whipped.
In another, shake Pink Pigeon Rum and Luxardo Espresso with ice.  Pour into a coupe, and then carefully top with the cream.  It should layer perfectly.  The vanilla complexity of the rum pairs awesomely with coffee and cream.

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Anejo Tequila, .25 oz Mezcal, .25 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 2 drops Agave Nectar, 3 dash Fee Brothers Aztec Chocolate Bitters, 2 cubes Sugar
Preparation:
In rocks glass, make an emulsion by using a glass muddler (wood muddlers absorb the ingredients too much). Place sugar cubes in glass. Add mezcal onto the cubes. Add bitters, onto cubes. Add drops of agave nectar, onto cubes. Add Luxardo, onto cubes. Muddle well to make a "syrup" paying attention the blending of all ingredients. 
Take the long orange peel and twist all the essential oils into glass. Leave peel in glass. 
Place Gläce Luxury Ice G-Cubed in glass. Rotate Gläce G-Cubed so that it becomes coated and chills the "syrup" swirl around the inside of glass. Pour the Anejo Tequila over Gläce G-Cubed. Stir with glass swizzle. Garnish with 3 Luxardo Cherries, speared.

Cocktail Name: And The Cherry On Top Is...
Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 3 oz Vodka, .5 oz Root 23 Cherry Almond Simple Syrup, 1 oz Lemon Juice,  splash Club Soda
Preparation: In the bottom of a cocktail shaker, muddle pitted cherries if using. Add Luxardo Maraschino, vodka, fresh lemon juice and simple syrup. Shake hard, then double strain (though a fine mesh strainer) into a tall glass with fresh ice. Add a splash of soda and stick a cherry on top.
Notes: Serves 2 Created & Featured in the September 2016 SaloonBox

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 1 oz Nigori sake (Unfiltered), .5 oz Fresh Shibori Yuzu juice, .5 oz Simple syrup (2:1 sugar water), .5 pc Thai chili, 4-5 sprigs Fresh cilantro (stems on)
Preparation:
In the small tin of a Boston shaker set, combine the cilantro sprigs, thai chili, yuzu juice, simple syrup and a small piece of ice. Muddle these ingredients well. Add the remaining liquid ingredients to the shaker with cracked ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. 
Double strain the cocktail over ice into a 13 oz. rocks glass. 
Garnish with the Thai chili piece and the cilantro sprig.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, 1 oz Potato juice*, .5 oz Benedictine, .5 oz Lemon juice , .25 oz Cinnamon honey syrup**, 1 bsp Black pepper, .5 bsp Salt
Preparation: Juice potato and strain into a nearby usable container (must be done as close to drink making process as possible since oxidization will occur quickly). Add vodka, potato juice, lemon, Benedictine, cinnamon-honey syrup, and salt and pepper to mixing glass. Add ice, and shake and fine strain over fresh ice.
Notes:
*Potato juice:
Wash potato, peel, chop, and put into a juicer

**Cinnamon honey syrup:
Cook cinnamon in hot water, strain and combine with equal parts hot water

Ingredients: 1  Half Small Cucumber, 1  Medium Carrot, 1  Green Apple, cored, 3-4  Kale Leaves, 1  Big Handful Spinach Leaves, 1  Small Hunk Ginger, .5-1 oz Pastis Prado
Preparation:
Juice the ingredients and pour into a chilled glass (do not use ice or the drink will lose body).

Top with Pastis Prado or absinthe and garnish with a sprig of mint.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh pressed Apple Cider, 4 oz Hard Apple Cider, 1 stick Cinnamon stick
Preparation: Method:  Simmer on a gentle heat for 30 minutes and garnish with a cinnamon stick

Ingredients: 2 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, 1 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Prickly Pear Puree, .5 oz Agave
Preparation: Mint salt on the rim. Garnish with mint sprig.

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 1 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 1.5 oz Cream of Coconut, .5 oz Fresh pineapple juice, .5 oz Fresh lime juice, 3 dashes Angostura bitters
Preparation: Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth and icy. Pout into a glass and top with 3 dashes of angostura bitters.

Ingredients: 3 c Pink Pigeon Rum, 3 c Orange Juice, 3 c Pineapple Juice, 3 c Ginger Ale, .25 c Grenadine, 1  Fresh-Squeezed Lime Juice
Preparation: Mix all ingredients in a large pitcher, add ice, and enjoy!

Ingredients: 1 oz Junipero Gin, 5 oz Compas Box Great King Street Blended Scotch Whisky, 1 oz Byrrh Grand Quinquina, .5 oz Anchor Christmas Ale 2016*, 2 dash Bittercube Corazon Bitters, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters
Preparation:
Mix all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for 15-20 secs depending on the type of ice. Strain over a large rock and garnish with an orange peel expressing the oils over the cocktail.

*Anchor Christmas Ale 2016 w/ Honey (reduction) 2:1 (2-parts Beer to 1-part Honey)

Ingredients: .75 oz Junipero Gin, .75 oz H by HINE, .75 oz Chateau de Montifaud Pineau des Charentes Blanc, .75 oz Oloroso & Moscatel Blend*, 2 dash The Bitter Truth Xocolate Bitters, 2 dash Orange Bitters,   Walnut Oil
Preparation:
Mix all ingredients in a tin except for the walnut oil. Utilizing the throwing technique, throw the mixture from one vessel to another vessel until chilled to air out the ingredients. Coat coupe glass with walnut oil and pour the mixture. Garnish with a dehydrated orange.

*Oloroso & Moscatel Blend:
-- 2 parts César Florido Moscatel Special
-- 1 part Lustau Oloroso Sherry

Blend ingredients.
Notes: Junipero Gin 20th Anniversary Signature Cocktail

Ingredients: .5 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .75 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 1 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, .25 oz Simple Syrup, 1 oz Perfect Puree White Peach, 3 oz Soda Water
Preparation: Mix all ingredients together.
Notes: Featured at the 2016/2017 SpeedRack

Ingredients: 1 oz H by HINE, .5 oz Orange Juice, .75 oz Lemon Juice, .25 oz Batavia Arrack, .5 oz Simple Syrup, 1 dash Angostura Bitters
Preparation: Mix all ingredients together.
Notes: Featured at the 2016/2017 SpeedRack

Ingredients: 1 oz No.3 London Dry Gin, 1 oz Tempus Fugit Alessio Vermouth di Torino Rosso, 1 oz Luxardo Bitter
Preparation: Mix all the liquid contents together in a heavy-bottomed tumbler with ice. Stir. Add a slice of orange and lemon zest to decorate.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Bay Leaf-Infused Honey Syrup*, 2 oz Clover's Gingersnap, 1 pinch Cinnamon
Preparation: Mix all together and shake and double strain into a coupe without ice. *Bay Leaf-Infused Honey Syrup: • 3 cups honey to 1 cup water • 4 bay leaves, crumbled Bring to a boil. Stir until honey completely dissolves in water. Turn off heat and allow 2 hours to cool.

Ingredients: 1 part Junipero Gin, 1 part King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 part Campari, 1 part Sweet Vermouth
Preparation: Mix equal parts of the 4 spirits and age in a 5 liter oak barrel for 30 days. Transfer into glass bottles and rest for a minimum of 3 days. Make giant (2" x 2") ice cubes with an orange peel frozen inside. Pour negroni on ice cube and serve.

Ingredients: 37.5 oz Hirsch Small Batch Reserve Bourbon, 6.25 oz Luxardo Amaretto di Saschira, 12.5 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 12.5 oz Sparkling Apple Juice, 6.25 oz Simple Syrup, 37.5 oz Seltzer
Preparation: Mix ingredients in the punch bowl.
Notes: Punch Serves: 25

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Christmas Spirit, 1 oz Oloroso Sherry, .25 oz Walnut Liqueur, 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 3 dash Pear Bitters
Preparation: Mix ingredients together then pour over crushed ice into a Julep tin. Dust with salt, sugar, and cinnamon.

Ingredients: .75 oz No.3 London Dry Gin or H by HINE, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 dash Simple Syrup, 1 float Sparkling Wine
Preparation: Mix the gin or cognac, lemon juice and syrup in a cocktail shaker. Pour the contents into a Champagne flute. Top up with Champagne. Add a Luxardo Cherry or a peel of lemon.

Cocktail Name: A Mi Manera (My Way) Pisco Punch
Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Selecto Italia Pisco, 1 oz Luxardo Apricot Liqueur, 2 oz Minta Soda, 1 pinch Citric Acid or Lime Juice, 1 scoop Pineapple Sorbet
Preparation: Mix the Pisco, apricot liqueur and citric acid ingredients together in a punch bowl and allow to rest for 45 minutes. Place a large 2.2 lb. ice block 10 minutes before serving. Scoop the pineapple sorbet in a punch glass and fill up with the mix, top up with mint-flavored soda. Garnish with candied pineapple wheel from Dress the Drink.
Notes: Served at the "Defining the Ultimate Pisco Punch Tasting Room" at Tales of the Cocktail 2015

Ingredients: .75 oz Blanco Tequila, .75 oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco, .75 oz Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, .75 oz Fresh Lime Juice, .25 oz Rich Simple Syrup (2:1)
Preparation: Mount all ingredients in a shaker tin. Add ice. Hard shake. Double strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with orange twist.

Ingredients: 2.5 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .5 oz Ginger Brown*, 4 dash Hella hula bitters, 3 beans Cocao beans
Preparation: Muddle 3 cacao beans in a mixing glass, add vodka, ginger-brown sugar, and Bitter Beast Hella Hula bitters. Add ice and vigorously shake to incorporate cacao flavor. Fine strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a cocao bean.
Notes:
*Ginger-Brown
Make a 2:1 brown sugar syrup and steep freshly chopped ginger root in for 24 hours. Strain.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Lime juice, .75 oz Simple syrup, 2  Mint leaves, muddled, 3  Cucumber slices, muddled
Preparation: Muddle 3-4 cucumber slices and a couple mint leaves. Shake and strain into martini or coupe glass. Garnish with lime or mint or cucumber.

Ingredients: 2 oz Karlsson's Gold Vodka, .75 oz Fresh Lemon Juice, 1 oz Simple Syrup (1:1), 3 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 5 large Basil Leaves, 16 whole Black Peppercorns
Preparation: Muddle 4 basil leaves, 16 peppercorns and simple syrup in shaker tin. Add all other ingredients except final basil leaf. Add ice. Shake vigorously. Fine strain into chilled cocktail glass. Express lemon oil from lemon swath over drink. Garnish with lemon swath and final basil leaf.

Ingredients: 2 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, 1 oz Fresh lime juice
Preparation:
Muddle a small handful of fresh mint leaves, ¾ oz simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water) 
1 oz fresh lime juice.
Add crushed ice to the glass to fill half way.
pour in 2 oz of Pink Pigeon.
Swizzle to incorporate ingredients and slowly add in the rest of the crushed ice.

Ingredients: 2 oz King's Ginger Liqueur, 1 oz Lime juice, .5 oz Cane sugar syrup, 2 oz Club soda
Preparation: Muddle basil in mixing glass, add all ingredients except club soda. Shake and strain into a collins glass, top with club soda.  Top with crushed ice and garnish with a basil sprig.

Ingredients: 2 oz Brandy, .5 oz Orange Cordial, 1 bsp Luxardo Sangue Morlacco Cherry Liqueur, 1  Luxardo Cherry (muddled), 1 dash Aromatic Bitters, 1 dash Cherry Bitters
Preparation: Muddle cherry in liquid ingredients. Shake, double strain over cracked ice. Garnish with two more cherries on a pick with an orange flag.

Ingredients: 2 oz Hophead Vodka, 3  Sun Gold Cherry Tomatoes, 4  Lovage Leaves, .75 oz Lime Juice, .5 oz Agave Syrup (1:1 agave to water), .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, 1 pinch Hepps Ghost Pepper Salt
Preparation: Muddle everything in a tin except Hophead. Then add Hophead and ice and shake and strain into a rocks glass with ice and garnish with a lovage sprig.
Notes:
Tasting notes- A curry like concoction with beautiful celery and tomato notes with a hint of spice in the back of the throat

Matthew chooses Sun Gold cherry tomatoes because they are easy to grow, care for, and yield an incredible amount of fruit. 
Tip: Never water the leaves, only the base of the plant.

Please visit EAT YOUR DRINK at www.matthewbiancaniello.com

Ingredients: 2.5 oz Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky, .25 oz Tippleman's Barrel Smoked Maple Syrup, 2 dash Regans' Orange Bitters, 5 dash Angostura Bitters, 1 disc Orange, 1 disc Lemon, 1 slice Peach
Preparation: Muddle fruit, bitters and syrup. Add ice (1 large cube if available). Top with Whisky. Long stir.

Ingredients: 2 oz BarSol Primero Quebranta Pisco, .5 oz Simple Syrup, .5 oz Orange Juice, .5 oz Lemon, 1 bsp El Guapo Tonic Syrup, 4 dash El Guapo Tonic Bitters, 3  Cucumber Slices, 2  Mint Sprig
Preparation: Muddle mint and cucumber with the simple syrup in a shaker tin. Combine the remainder of the ingredients in the tin. Shake vigorously. Double strain with a fine mesh strainer into a collins glass. Fill with ice and garnish with a cucumber slice.

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, 1 oz Fresh Ginger Syrup, 1 slice Orange slice, 1 dash Chinese Five Spice Bitters
Preparation: Muddle Orange Slice. Add Nikka. Add Ginger Syrup. Stir over Ice. Add bitters.
Notes: Recipe credit goes to: Jennifer Costello, Charles Lintott & Sarah Holmes

Ingredients: 2 oz Nikka Whisky Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 YO, .5 oz Luxardo Amaro Abano, 3 dash House-made Rasta Bitters
Preparation: Muddle orange twist with sugar. Add ice. Pour ingredients over ice. Add bitters

Ingredients: 1 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Luxardo Aperitivo, .5 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Lemon juice, 1 float Ginger beer, 4 pieces Chopped pineapple, 3 pieces Ginger root
Preparation: Muddle pineapple and ginger root, lemon juice and simple syrup, then add Aperitivo and rum, shake well, over ice and top up with Ginger beer.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Pink Pigeon Rum, .5 oz Simple syrup, .5 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Luxardo Bitter, 1 float Ginger beer, 4 pieces Pineapple, 4 pieces Ginger root
Preparation: Muddle pineapple and ginger root, lemon juice and simple syrup. Add rum. Shake well, over ice and top with ginger beer and Luxardo Bitter

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Peach Puree, .75 oz Lime Juice, 3  Raspberries, 1 oz Sparkling Wine
Preparation: Muddle raspberries in mixing glass. Add remainder of ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a well chilled coupe. Top off with sparkling wine. Garnish with raspberry and mint.

Ingredients: 1 oz Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, .5 oz Peach Puree, .75 oz Lime Juice, 3  Raspberries
Preparation: Muddle raspberries in mixing glass. Add remainder of ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously strain over fresh ice. Garnish with raspberry and mint.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Chinaco Reposado Tequila, .5 oz Luxardo Triplum (Triple Sec), .75 oz Fresh grapefruit juice, .5 oz Lemon juice, .5 oz Simple syrup, 4 pieces Red bell pepper, 4 oz Mint sprigs
Preparation:
Muddle red pepper and mint. Add all other ingredients. Shake well over ice and strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with red pepper slice and mint sprig.

Ingredients: 2 oz Breck Bourbon, .5 oz Dancing Pines Black Walnut Bourbon, .5 oz Punt e Mes, .25 oz King's Ginger Liqueur
Preparation: Muddle sage and Thyme. Stirred, over ice in single rocks glass. Burnt orange, and thyme sprig to garnish.

Ingredients: 1.5 oz Chinaco Blanco Tequila, 1 oz Wild Hibiscus Tea, .5 oz Fresh Lime Juice, .5 oz Agave Nectar,   Strawberries,  top Sparkling Water
Preparation: Muddle strawberries in a shaker with agave nectar, add lime juice, hibiscus tea, and Chinaco Blanco. Top with sparkling water.

Ingredients: .5 tsp Demerara Sugar, 1  Roasted Cherry, 2 oz Cherry-Infused Vodka, .25 tsp Amaro di Angostura, .25 tsp Luxardo Maraschino Liqueur, 5 dash Miracle Mile Forbidden Barrel Aged Bitters
Preparation:
